text: Saya tinggal semalam di hotel ini, letaknya bukan di sentral ubud. Memang kamar saya diupgrade dengan pemandangan kolam dan sawah, namun kamarnya sangat biasa saja. Letak kamar jauh ke belakang dan harus berjalan kaki lumayan jauh, namun lucunya, owner hotel bisa memarkir kendaraannya tepat didepan jalan hotel, sedang kami para tamu harus parkir jauh di depan lobby dan berjalan cukup jauh ke belakang. Tidak ada fasilitas buggy menuju bangunan hotel. Memang owner memiliki properti tepat disamping hotel, namun menurut saya kurang pas membiarkan tamu berjalan kaki begitu jauh sementara ada 1 mobil nangkring di depan bangunan dekat bangunan hotel. Saya tidak tahu kualitas sarapan paginya, karena saya membeli voucher hotel tanpa sarapan. Staffnya ramah, baik dan helpful. Hanya ada beberapa tamu saat saya menginap disini. Namun saat jam makan siang, penuh dengan tamu dari Tiongkok untuk spa dan makan siang. Kolam renang cukup lebar, dan saat saya menginap, tanaman padi sudah dipanen, mungkin saat musim tanam pemandangan jauh lebih baik. Disediakan shuttle ke Ubud di jam-jam tertentu. Buat saya, sekali saja sudah cukup menginap disini.

text:
A big hotel with nice rice field views that has the potency to score a nine. The bedroom was specious with good beds, air conditioning, free wifi  and a clean and big bathroom. However the pool area was old and worn out, just ten old wooden sun chairs with dirty cushion’s (this for a big hotel with many rooms) and a big concrete terrace where you can lie on the free beach towel (not very comfortable). Please put some chairs or bean bags at the terrace and it would do wonders. At the rice fields is another area with two wooden day beds and a wonderful view but the beds are not maintained, dirty and paintless. Such a pity because with just a little paint and some cleaning it is a nice place to relax. The free breakfast buffet is very limited ( toasted bread, butter, 2 sorts of jam and fruit) with a menu to choose between pancakes, eggs and nasi. A pity it takes nearly 40 minutes to get the meal.
On a positive note the staff are helpful, efficient and cheerful and the free shuttle into the charming and lively town of Ubud is a welcome facility.
title: A big hotel with nice rice field views that has the potency to score a nine

text:
My boyfriend and I stayed at Amatara Royal Ganesha for 2 nights and had a wonderful time. 
We stayed in the suite room which had amazing views overlooking the rice terraces and the pool.
The pool was our favourite part of this hotel. The view is amazing and it was so relaxing to spend time here during the day. 

We also ate at the restaurant a number of times and all the food we tried was delicious.

There is a shuttle that takes guests into town at certain times, we had to get a driver when we wanted to go into Ubud when the shuttle wasn’t running. My only criticism is that it’s a little far from the main “strip” of restaurants and shops in Ubud, I would have liked to walk to the strip anytime I wanted instead of waiting for a shuttle, but overall we were treated very well at the Royal Casa Ganesha!

The only downside of this is that typically during our stay we receive 3-5pm free afternoon tea with snacks, on our first day of staying we were expecting this but were told by kitchen staff it wasn't available since it was our first night of stay. Reception told us we could still have it and what we think may be the case, since we were the only guests on site they could not be bothered to make it just for us. We did receive it in the end but I think it just goes to show that the hotel seemed quite new tot he four star game. Apart from this incidence the staff were super friendly, food was great and views are stunning. The Spa is overpriced so would recommend you going into town for that. text:
This place is so close to Ubud Centre an yet so quiet. You can wake up early and enjoy the sunrise by the pool with a view of the rice fields. 

The rooms were clean and the staff do their best to meet our needs. The pool was slippery and dirty though. the floors of the pool were covered in slippery algae. 

There are free pick ups /drop off shuttles to and from Ubud Centre at different times of the day.

The hotel is very close to the Tenegunan Waterfalls and the Monkey Forest and Ubud Centre. 

BREAKFAST: 

A la carte breakfast- not much choice for vegetarians though. 
while we were there we had a choice : Pancakes served with ricotta cheese or french toast or chicken waffles or eggs. 

The chicken waffle was not available on any of the days we were there though and on 2 days the french toast option was not either so you are not left with much choice. 

The only vegetarian option was yoghurt served with granola and fruits.  

Your breakfast choice is served with complimentary fruit juice. fruits , a croissant and two tiny pieces of garlic bread and tea/coffee. 

DINNER/ BAMBOO KOENING RESTAURANT: 

We had dinner at the Bamboo Koening Restaurant twice. The food isn't that great though. neither are the desserts. Better to have your meals in Ubud before coming back to the hotel.  the panda creme brûlée did not taste like panda at all. it was basically green food colouring added to a normal creme brûlée. The pizza and pasta aren't great either. 

POOL: 

The size of the pool is nice and it gives an amazing view on to the rice fields behind the hotel. Sunrise here is mesmerising. So worth an early wake up. 

The floors of the pool were dirty though.. Our feet turned green with algae and it was very slippery. We asked the staff if they could clean it and the next day they did clean it but it was still very slippery. 

ROOMS:

i was staying with my sisters so the triple room were perfect for us. the rooms were clean  as well as the bathroom. No mosquitoes inside the rooms or any other insect. 

Ask for a pool view room it will be much nicer. 

Free wifi in rooms and all hotel areas. 
Free shuttle to and from Ubud Centre twice or thrice a day. 

Hotel staff very friendly and helpful.
title: Rice Fields View- Romantic Sunrise/ Quiet place so close to Ubud/

text:
I stumbled across this hotel the morning that we were travelling from Gili Trawangan to Ubud and got a really good rate for it (under £30 for two people). The value for money was phenomenal; this is most definitely a four star hotel with the mod-cons but also holds a gorgeous view of the surrounding fields (photos to follow).

If you desire something more in the jungle, I wouldn't recommend it. However, we stayed only one night and wanted access to Ubud Palace and surrounding shops/ restaurants, and the Monkey Forest. This hotel provided the perfect spot and had a free shuttle that took us to and from town upon request.

Breakfast was a unique combination of foods but fine. Room service can be paid for in cash upon delivery. My only criticism is that the restaurant closed at 7pm (ordering food from outside is not permitted). Therefore, we went to bed with no dinner that evening.

The hotel is impeccably clean; the cleanest of all three of the hotels I stayed in during my trip to Bali. There is room to venture around some of the grounds which are stunning. The infinity pool makes for great photo memories and although I did not make use of the spa, I assume it was equally to a high standard.

The staff were friendly, our shuttle driver had a great personality and would sing along to the radio as we drove. All in all, a great stay - I highly recommend.
title: Unexpected, pleasant surprise. Absolute bargain

Good morning from Ubud!

text: I stayed in this hotel when they just opened for 2 months. Since the hotel is new and the location is not in central Ubud, it is very quiet which I liked after my stay in busy Nusa Dua resorts. The room was clean and spacious. The pool was facing the rice fields which was calming and wonderful. It was not peak season when I came, so there were not many hotel guests and the hotel decided to provide an a la carte breakfast with selections of Western, Continental, Indonesian, or Balinese breakfast and includes coffee/tea, juice, and a fruit plate. Even though it seems that you do not have many choices for the breakfast, the portion is good enough for one person because it won't feel good anyway if you fill up your stomach too much in the morning. The staff said if it's peak season, they will provide a breakfast buffet. The hotel provides complimentary shuttle bus to central Ubud (Ubud Palace) 3 times a day. The staff service was very friendly and helpful. Overall, I enjoyed staying in this quiet hotel and I hope they finish all the facilities soon.
title: Quiet and Relaxing Stay

text:
Stayed for 4 nights in October, end of our Bali trip. Gorgeous hotel, in a jungle setting, breakfast excellent with warm friendly staff.   We stayed in the deluxe double room, breakfast included. Exactly as on website photos, clean and great size, very comfortable bed.  View of the pool from our room & the jungle vibe, best of both worlds. The Flat white coffee,  I asked for strong!  was delicious had two daily after the first one. Room service was quick and food was gorgeous especially the vegetarian burger and chips. Wine expensive more than double the price in Ireland but that is common in Bali, nice wine though.  Cocktails lovely had two on the last night, great value.
Only got to use the infinity pool for a couple of hours on last day as it rained most of the time but it was lovely when I did use it. Can practically walk into the rice field beside the pool which was cool. Massage was fabulous had a facial, foot massage and full body hot stone massage on different days and they where amazing. Would highly recommend the masseuse was just lovely and ginger tea the end  was a nice touch.  Met the owner who came over and chatted to us he was a lovely man and is building villas on site at the moment, to expand, this in no way affected our stay. 
Only down side was we had people beside us dragging furniture across the tiled floor which was really noisy and woke us up a few times. Lots to do in Ubud highly recommend a visit. 
This hotel has a free shuttle taxi twice a day to Ubud centre.
title: Tropical Jungle Vibe

partner_attribution: Ulasan dikumpulkan dalam kemitraan dengan hotel ini

text:
Staff: Commending everyone for being so accommodating and friendly. English was not their first language but it was totally not an issue. Everyone was smiling at you, from the receptionists, the cleaners, the kitchen guys. Hello to Ari who fetched us with their FREE shuttle service. 
Food: Value for money. It was not 5-star good but for a cheap price, it was surprisingly good. You have like 8 choices and yoi can request to jave omelette for free. 
Accommodation: I've been to hotels from other countries and I can say they can compete with the amenities. Pool view was instagrammable. The rooms were clean enough, towels smooth, hot water is consistent. The only suggestion is to have an insect killer in the hotel to drive away the flies. The hotel itself was clean but there were some flies. 

Overall, it was a good stay. I would recommend this to people who want a short vacation, away from the stressful life in the metropolis.
title: Excellent stay, no major issues

text:
First of all thank you for the asking review we are also hotelier and we know minimum requirement according to  what we paid, clean room, help full staff, nice breakfast and good sleeping,  
Let’s start: 
We head late c/in but front desk staff was amazing and very help foul he is brilliant for the property,room not to worst but cleaning disaster specially at bathroom, amenity quality so cheap. Shower head very dirty and water stacking towels very dirty and old

Minibar very poor only two beer and two coke don’t put muni bar better :)) 
Worst part we are coming I do booking breakfast include I do expect at Bali holiday different juices and nice local breakfast favorites we receive small fruit platter (4 kind fruits, watermelon, rack melon very hard, papaya and pine apple no sweet aswell) expect black coffee no coffee variety no cappuccino, no latte or espresso,

text:
My friend and I stayed here in January as we were exploring Ubud for a couple days, and let me tell you, this resort is fantastic! We arrived late from airport our first night, meaning we didn’t have a lot of time our first night to look around, however they checked us in very quickly and delivered our bags to our room. The next morning I was so happy to see the views the hotel has, the rice fields are absolutely gorgeous and surround this beautiful hotel! The staff were incredibly friendly, always smiling, always saying hello and very happy to help. The room was clean and so comfortable and included complimentary water. On our last day I called the front desk to ask for a cab, only to find a staff member offering to drive me in their shuttle to my next accommodation at a cheaper price. Ari was so kind and lovely to talk to! If you get a chance to stay at this hotel I would absolutely recommend it.

-Syd
title: Above and Beyond!

text:
The resort is quite lovely with great view of rice fields from some of the rooms and also the pool. I stayed in a suite which had a great view balcony to the pool and rice fields. The room itself was well fitted and quite comfortable. 
The all day restaurant near the pool had great food. Ate 3 meals here - all great but the Nasigoreng stood out as one of the best I tried during my entire stay. I didn't do the floating breakfast myself but it seemed super popular and was very set-up and looked attractive. 
The hotel is a bit out of the way but they provide a shuttle service, and the staff at the reception were always helpful and drove in case you wanted to go at a time when the shuttle was not travelling (at a charge). 
The only irritating thing was that there was only 1 plug point in the room which was near the desk and for someone having multiple devices and no adapter it was a bit inconvenient. I'll remember to bring an adapter next time
Would definitely stay there again. I can't remember the names of any the staff specifically but every single one of them was wonderful.
title: Good hotel to stay at with lovely staff

text:
We stayed here for five nights in November, as a couple in our late twenties.
We arrived very jet lagged and were warmly welcomed. We had a nice meal and few drinks in the restaurant. Pleasantly surprised by the quality of food available :) I had a healthy bowl with avocado / quinoa and a range of bright veggies.
Next day we were blown away by the breakfast. Included in the room price you were given a menu each day to choose from including pancakes, eggs benedict, and local things such as curry / noodles. All totally delicious.
Our free 30 min massage was completely wonderful. Lovely ladies with good pressure.
The room was great. Huge comfy bed and small fridge just what we needed.
Pool area was dreamy. Infinity overlooking rice fields. Towels provided. Very attentive team available for food/drinks if you needed but who left you to relax.
Free shuttle into ubud was great. We went in at 6 and returned at 9 most nights.
We did yoga at the hotel, approx £7.50 each for a private lesson for two! & hired a scooter approx £4 per 24hours.
Definitely visit here, wonderful team who will make your holiday special :)
title: Tranquil paradise

text:
This was without any doubt, the highlight of our time in Bali. Upon arrival, we were warmly welcomed and treated like royalty. 
From then on, every encounter with any personnel was excellent.

We stayed in a fully airconditioned suite room on the second floor! The room was ample size, the super king large bed was super comfortable with luxe linens! A private bathroom with bath and window overlooking the pool, a spacious shower, nice fixtures, plush towels, bath robes, slippers, and top of the line toiletries. We also had a large flat screen television, a kettle with free coffee & tea, 2 bottles of water and a mini fridge. The views from our room were gorgeous! Loved having a roomy balcony overlooking the pool and the beautiful scenery surrounding the resort! A perfect way to wind down after a long day sunbathing on the deckchairs.

Beyond the relaxing atmosphere of the villa, the next best part was the amazing food! They have 2 restaurants, both with super excellent service. The menus have a great variety of food and beverage choices and the preparation made for superior tasting. We had breakfast, lunch and dinner there and were truly satisfied! The prices were very, very reasonable. They also offer the floating breakfast which was truly an amazing experience for us! The view of sunrise from the pool, overlooking the lush greenary while having a floating breakfast was mesmerizing. 

Location of the resort is in a quiet and peaceful environment, 15 minutes away  from Ubud centre! You can easily rent a bike from the resort! They also offer a free shuttle service to the surrounding areas! 

Last but least, the staff was one of the best part of staying at the Amatata Royal Ganesha. Everyone was so very thoughtful and caring to ensure that we enjoyed our stay. They keep the resort super clean and well run! 

Thank you for such an unforgettable experience! We will definitely be back!
title: Perfect stay in Bali

text:
We stumbled across Amatara Royal Ganesha after deciding we wanted to head to Ubud for a few days whilst holidaying in Bali.  We are two couples travelling together and we were initially hesitant to book this hotel because the,price was so cheap, but after reading lots of great reviews on Trip Advisor, we decided to go with it and we absolutely loved it.  We stayed for five nights which was probably a little bit too long because it’s very quiet being about ten minutes drive from the heart of Ubud but we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  The rooms are really spacious and spotlessly clean, (bathrooms are probably a little bit small,) meals were excellent and the staff are all super friendly and cannot do enough for you.  Free wi-fi is included.
The hotel provides free shuttles in and out of Ubud but if the times don’t suit, a cab can be arranged for around AUD$7.50 which for the four of us was very cheap.
The swimming pool is amazing, once again, spotlessly clean. There’s a covered deck area on the top floor (the fourth floor,) where you can get fabulous views and pics looking out over all the fields and rice paddies, just beautiful.
Wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again or recommend it to others, it might not be five star but it was certainly a lovely surprise for the four of us, given the price for our stay
Definitely give the Amatara Royal Ganesha a try, you’d be hard to please if you didn’t like it.
title: Real Value for Money!

text:
Situated back off the main road down a long driveway, the hotel should have everything going for it.  Set in picturesque rice paddies and palm groves and with a backdrop dominated by an enormous volcano rising through it's cloud cover, it's open reception area is attractive, it's infinity pool large beautifully maintained and inviting, it's rooms perfectly acceptable and balconied.  And yet ...... it lacks any kind of buzz.  The kind generated by people.
Our group of 24 virtually had the place to ourselves until another small group turned up.  The place lacks the focal point normally provided by a bar and a lounge or even a poolside bar.  As regards the latter there obviously has been one but it stands closed and overgrown, similarly a bit of exploration reveals a large rooftop bar terrace with stunning views and huge sunset potential yet that too stands long disused.
The restaurant is out'n'out spartan and alongside some pretty ordinary food provides an overall atmosphere tinged with gloom and despondency.  Breakfast is just about OK.
A large, very new and very plush restaurant just across the main road from the entrance and a 10 minute stroll away provides an alternative for eating, although there is a wide choice in the town.
On a positive note the staff are helpful, efficient and cheerful and the free shuttle into the charming and lively town of Ubud is a welcome facility - as are the coupons issued upon arrival for free welcome drinks, cocktails and massage sessions.
I note that it has recently undergone a change of name.  I hope it presages a change of fortune.  It deserves it.
title: .... just needs more buzz.

text:
Stayed here for 2 nights towards the end of our Indonesian trip and it was awesome!

The hotel is located in a big area with lots of gardens, greenery, a really big swimming pool overlooking rice fields. It is the perfect place if you want to have a quiet and relaxing place in Ubud! This is definitely the biggest pool we have seen in all the places we stayed in Indonesia. It was clean, well-kept and also kids friendly!

The room was good size - biggest compared to other places we had stayed in Bali, and had a balcony and a nice bathroom with shower. Our room overlooked the pool and the rice fields, and it was nice to be able to sit on the balcony and see the birds!

Breakfast at the restaurant was yummy - loved the american breakfast, fruits, juice and coffee that was served.

Staff were very friendly and helpful. Special thanks to Deva who really helped us with arranging a scooter, and dropped/picked us up from Ubud Central in the hotel shuttle.

Highly recommend staying at RCG if you are ever visiting Ubud and looking for a place to relax and wind down!
title: Lovely hotel with beautiful gardens and amazing staff

text:
It was our honeymoon, we stayed here for 7 days. We booked this hotel for the quietness & the infinity pool. It was quiet to a seclusion extent, we thought being a few minutes away from the center is helpful but you're actually not walking distance away from anything cause the hotel itself is way deep that you need a buggy to get to the main road, it's also a 2-3 min walk from the rooms to the lobby that was a bit of a hassle up and down all the time, and local taxis or apps don't get there easily. They do have a shuttle to Ubud center at three different drop-off and pickup times. Which we used once, cause the areas we went to mostly weren't that close to the drop off point so we'd rather go with a taxi from the start.
The view from our room was nice but the moment we entered it had a weird smell, the water in the shower was a medium temperature not hot enough, the water stream was also spread in a weird way, the body gel dispenser was almost empty when we got there, and there was no shampoo, so you should bring your own. The first night we slept it off cause we checked in at 1 AM we complained the next day about the smell and the stream in the shower, they suggested moving us to another room, which was worse, so we asked for deep cleaning for our room and we stayed in it, they also fixed the water stream in the shower and after they cleaned the smell got better, but the day after it came back.
Moving on to the lovely pool, it was dirty we asked them to clean it they did but it wasn't that great. 
The room service food wasn't bad, they close at 10 PM we didn't try the Bamboo restaurant cause we saw it empty the whole time (not a good sign)
The most disappointing thing was the complimentary bowl of fruits they have for you in the room was left there; we never ate from it and they never renewed it, so by the fourth day, we woke up to what you see in the picture; The fruits were rotten. 

Overall we would rate our experience as a 2/5 but the very friendly staff made it a 3. That was the best thing in our stay they were always smiling and ready to help you with whatever. We once came in at 7:30 PM exhausted from a long day around Bali, we asked for a massage and they agreed although the spa closes at 6 PM.
 It's a nice hotel but they need to work more on the basics then add more amenities and entertainment since they are that secluded.
title: Not as expected! & Definitely not for a 7 day stay!

text:
To be honest this was not great but for what it is, and for the price, it is good value. 
The service staff are great, very accommodating and extremely helpful, really good. 
The place looks like luxury resort but when you get to the room it is simply your average hotel.

Being far (5-7 min)from Ubud made this a bit of a hassle for me as I like walking in the thick of it, I did like the quiet though I must admit.  The shuttle service is not frequent enough but at least there is a service, the staff will get you a ride ( 60K) into town if you need. 
The kitchen is way over priced for what it is, Ubud has such great food (cheap high quality) on offer that it is a waste to spend 3 times as much for an ok-ish meal. I did appreciate the breakfast, nothing to rave home about but hey, it’s free!

Overall ok, the best part about it is that it is close to a great traditional ( expensive for Bali but worth it!) restaurant which offers great duck dishes .... just search on nearby restaurants.
title: No big deal

text:
This was our first hotel we stayed in when we visited Bali, and we immediately wanted to stay here longer. The staff are really attentive from arrival and always remembered who you were. 
We had a triple room overlooking the rice paddies and it was the most amazing view we could have asked for. The bathtub overlooked the paddies too and was just spectacular. Our room was located in the back part of the hotel and it was really quiet and peaceful. There is a lot of ghekos around the room, which didn't bother us but may if you're a little squeamish.
We only tried the breakfast here, which we thought was included but we got charged anyway .. strange. Breakfast was ok, wasn't a lot of choice apart from rice and chicken and traditional food. 
The hotel has a beautiful pool overlooking the paddies and it was always nice and quiet when we were there.
We left our cases here for one night as we went to stay at Gili T and they were securely looked after. The staff were really helpful and friendly, especially when we had a powercut, they came straight up to fix it.
Only thing that bothered us was how hot our room was, as you can't leave the aircon on while you're out. It heats up quite a bit throughout the day and takes a while to cool down again.
All in all, I loved this hotel and would go back again in a heartbeat. Would definitely take part in the yoga next time too!

Also, taxis to the hotel tend to rip you off as they 'don't know where it is'. But it shouldn't cost you more than 70k for a taxi ride from Ubud centre, so don't pay any more than that.
title: Beautiful views

I will write here a few points u need to consider before u order a place in this hotel:

4. The battery of the electronic door lock was about to die so it made an alarm sound all night. It kept beeping for hours and hours, and no body could turn it off. We didn't sleep all night and our neighbors neither ... eventually at 5 in the morning they moved us to a nice room that wasn't that stinky, but it was reserved to another guess so we couldn't stay there. Just to be fair I want to emphasize that the staff were very nice and did what was in their power - they really tried to help although there wasn't much they could do ....

По комфортности и еде есть вопросы.
Горячая вода часто шла с перебоями не сильно горячая, вай фай достаточно слабый, в некоторых номерах почти не работает.
Еда вегетарианская, если приходить на завтрак чуть позже, достаточно маленькое количество фруктов, дорезают по запросу, но изобилия мало.
Все скрашивает виды гор из номеров и безумно зелёная территория, очень милый персонал.
При выезде забыла несколько вещей, они оперативно сами нашли и вернули.
Очень желаю администрации отеля разнообразить еду, добавить её количество и настроить скоростной интернет.
title: Проживание на тренинге

Wij hebben dit hotel geboekt om Ubud te verkennen, mount Batur te beklimmen en te relaxen. 
De kamer stonk ontzettend (putje achter de wc) en er zaten nog haren van vorige gasten in het doucheputje... een briefje neergelegd voor de schoonmaak waarna het wel gedaan is maar naar mijn idee kan dit echt niet.
De geur in de wc roken we de 2e dag ook bij het zwembad, ik zou het omschrijven als riool/urine. Om die reden ook daar niet de hele dag gelegen.
Het ontbijt is goed, personeel is super vriendelijk en het bed slaapt fijn. Makkelijk bereikbaar, lopend naar het centrum is wat ver maar dat wisten we bij het boeken.
Zwembad is netjes maar je kijkt niet uit zoals de foto’s laten zien, de mooie rijstvelden zitten naast het hotel. Water van het zwembad was erg warm waardoor je niet afkoelde.
title: Meer verwacht

Eerste hotel van onze rondreis door Bali en wat een goede start! Lekker bed, douche en ruime kamers met een goede airco. Er rijdt een shuttlebus, dus vervoer naar Ubud is geen probleem. In de buurt zijn genoeg activiteiten te regelen (zie: kdong ding cooking class) maar je kunt ook lekker blijven hangen in de infinity pool met een goede cocktail. Speciale dank aan miss Ary, de buscoureur van Ubud....altijd op tijd!

Nous avons séjourné 3 jours dans cet hôtel dans le cadre d’un tour organisé sur Bali.
Le cadre est magnifique, grand complexe hôtelier dans la végétation. Les chambres sont spacieuses, très propres. La douche est très grande.
Le personnel est accueillant, serviable et souriant. 
Le petit déjeuner est bon, copieux. Il est à la carte mais tout le monde peut y trouver son compte ! Servis rapidement et bien présentés.
Les jus de fruits sont frais, un plus !
Les plats sont bons, épicés juste ce qu’il faut.

L’emplacement est un peu loin du centre de Ubud, mais une navette gratuite nous y amène et nous ramène ensuite. 

La piscine est magnifique, donnant sur les rizières, très propres, avec des linges de bains à disposition.

Je conseille vivement cet emplacement pour son cadre, sa propreté, son côté relaxant.

text:
A Bali pour une dizaine de jours, nous avons passé 4 nuits au Amatara Royal Ganesha. Bien mal nous en a pris. 

Points positifs :
- Literie très agréable
- Bel emplacement dans les rizières, proche d'Ubud

Points négatifs : 
- Le restaurant de l'hôtel est un désastre. Les plats arrivent très lentement (40 minutes pour avoir un pancake), la carte proposée par défaut ne contient que des plats occidentaux non maîtrisés et mal préparés. Les plats arrivent régulièrement froids et le staff oublie souvent une partie des commandes. En ce qui concerne le petit déjeuner, les portions diminuent chaque jour sans aucune explication. Le personnel du restaurant devient rapidement désagréable lorsque l'on signale un souci. Il est intéressant de noter la différence de service entre les touristes ayant le petit déjeuner inclus dans leur réservation et ceux qui le payent comme un repas à part entière.
- Une musique de fonds de quelques minutes tourne en boucle en permanence dans l'hôtel, ce qui devient rapidement insupportable.
- L'équipement des chambres n'est pas entretenu (plusieurs lumières cassées dans la mienne, le lavabo avait une fuite). Nous n'avons pas eu d'eau chaude pendant 2 jours d'affilée.
- Le room service ne nettoie pas correctement les chambres (poubelle non vidée, papier toilette non approvisionné, vaisselle de chambre sale).
- Le personnel ne comprend pas toujours bien l'anglais. Ceux qui maîtrisent mieux cette langue essayent en permanence de vendre les différentes activités de l'hôtel, au point d'en devenir lourds.
- L'hôtel propose des navettes pour Ubud, à des heures non flexibles et mal placées.
- Mauvaise isolation sonore des chambres.

En conclusion, un endroit correct uniquement pour y dormir et absolument rien d'autre.
title: L'hôtel le plus catastrophique de notre séjour à Bali

text: V tomto hotelu jsme strávili pár dní, objednali jsme přes booking, pokoj pro 3 osoby. Pokoj byl pěkný, čistý, 3 jednolůžkové postele, tak jak jsme chtěli, vše 3x,  byla zde docela malá skříň pro 3 lidi.Píši to proto, že většinou se nám stává, že mají problém s třetí osobou a pokoje jsou připravené pro 2 osoby... Na pokoji je rychlovarná konvice , čaje a káva. V lednici nějaké limonády, každý den dostáváte vodu ve skle. Další jiná voda není v areálu dostupná, je třeba si ji koupit. Snídaně bohaté, vždy na výběr z několika možností a pult na ovoce a pečivo. Je zde také možnost, objednat si snídani do bazénu, kterou jsme, bohužel nestihli. Výhled z pokojů, které mají balkony jsou do zeleně, nebo na rýžová pole a když je štěstí tak na sopku.  Tento hotel je stranou od centra, je tu tudíž klid. Hotel nabízí službu, kdy vás v určitou hodinu odvezou a přivezou z města. Všechen personál je velice přátelský a příjemný, ochotný vyhovět jakémukoli přání, tak jako všude na Bali. Jsou prostě úžasní. Bazén a další služby jsme ani nevyužili. Bylo to spíše strategické místo pro naše výlety po okolí. Ve městě se dá výborně najíst, sehnat taxi na celý den, nebo nakoupit. A smlouvejte, smlouvejte :) Užijte si to!
title: Příjemné místo

text:
子供の卒園祝いにこのホテルに宿泊しました。
まずお部屋からの景色にが素晴らしい。田園風景、緑に囲まれたスイミングプールを
私たちが宿泊した部屋から見渡せました。特に朝はお天気に恵まれ、田園風景の上に
朝焼けが広がり本当にうっとりしました。

お部屋は清潔で至るところにお花がアクセントとして添えられていました。
とっても広くてびっくりです。

印象的なのは大きなスイミングプールです。緑に囲まれ、鳥が飛び交う様子を見ながら贅沢な時間をすごしました。プールサイドにはガゼボがあり、希望すれば
ここでお食事もできます。
緑の中の食事があまりにも気持ちよく、滞在中2回このガゼボで食事を頂きました。

お食事も大変美味しかったです。私が注文したのはクリスピーダック。
スープが付いているほか、好きなデザートまで選べて大変お得に感じました。
その他インドネシアのメニューやトムヤム（タイメニュー）など豊富に揃っていました。
子供にもポテトフライ、ピザやスパゲッティーなど食べやすいメニューが
揃っていたので助かりました。子供はスパゲッティーが気に入り、２回注文しました。嫌いな食材を抜くなどフレキシブルに温かく対応してくださり感謝です。

朝食はアラカルトで好きなメインコースが選べます。種類がたくさんあって
とても迷いました。とても美味しかったです。私はフレンチトーストを頂きました。
子供はパンケーキ。インドネシア系メニューもありました。エッグベネディクトも
食べてみたかったです。お腹一杯になりました。

お話が楽しいベテランスタッフさん、一生懸命お仕事をこなされる若手スタッフさんも大変よかったです。レストランでは若手スタッフさんが子供と遊んでくれました。子供たちも大変楽しかったようです。
（チェックアウトしてすぐにまたここに来たいと話しているので本当に楽しかったのでしょう）

ウブド市内まではシャトルサービスもあります。

この緑に囲まれた心地よい空間を考えるとこのホテルは本当に
コストバリューが高いと思えました。
日本人のお客様が多いというのも日本人として納得です。

最後にマネージャーのスナルガさん。色々と私たち家族が快適に
過ごせるよう温かいお心遣いを下さり有難うございました。
エネルギッシュなマネージャーさん率いるスタッフさんが
一生懸命にお仕事に取り組まれている様子が伝わってきました。

再訪を楽しみにしています。
title: コストバリュー満点！美しい景色に癒されるステイ

text:
Nous avons passé 5 nuits dans l'hotel Royal Casa Ganesha, étant en vacances en famille à Bali. Nous avons tout de suite été charmé par ce petit hotel à l'allure élégante et pourtant assez modeste. Le personnel à été directement aux petits soins, et l'est resté durant toute la durée de notre voyage. Disponible et souriant, nous avons été gâtés. 

Les chambres sont assez classiques, d'une propreté impeccable, spacieuses (nous logions dans les chambres Deluxe) et offrant une belle vue sur les rizières et sur la végétation caractéristique de la région. L'hotel était très calme, nos nuits n'ont été altérées que par des bruits de travaux car l'hotel effectuait des rénovations pendant notre séjour. 

Le restaurant est correct, mais un peu cher par rapport à ce que l'on peut trouver à Ubud. Par contre, les cuisines ferment assez tôt (21h). Le petit-déjeuner est classique mais plus axé sur les mets indonésiens que ceux que l'on peut retrouver chez nous, nous offrant une immersion totale. 

L'hotel est situé à environ 15 minutes du centre d'Ubud en voiture, donc impossible d'y accéder à pieds (attention dès lors dans l'organisation de vos visites). Trois navettes par jour sont disponibles sur demande, ce qui est très correct et utile pour ne pas avoir trop de frais supplémentaires en taxi (attention à nouveau la dernière est à 21h, parfois compliqué pour manger le soir...)
title: Hotel spacieux, au charme et à l'hospitabilité remarquables

text:
3回目の滞在です。
前回とレセプションの位置が変わっていました。(以前はお部屋棟の1階)
新しいレセプションは素敵なレストランスパの横を通ってお部屋棟に行くのでワクワク感が有ります。

前回迄の2回は友人と一緒だったのでロイヤルスィート301に宿泊しました。
このお部屋は東西南北の景色が見えます。特にお風呂からの景色は素晴らしいです。料金もリーズナブルなのでお得感があります。
今回は一人だったので､一番下のカテゴリー(シャワーのみ)のお部屋に宿泊したしたが一人では十分な広さでした。
アメニティは歯ブラシとボディーローション以外はだいたいあります。
どちらのお部屋にも言える事ですが､ベランダの奥行きがもう少し広ければ良いのになぁと思います。

プールはウブドのホテルの中でも広い方だと思います。景色も良いしあまり人がいないので気持ち良く泳げます。

レストランの朝食は､この値段のホテルなりです…(^^;
街で買ったフルーツをジュースにして頂きました^^
今回から3:00pm〜5:00pmにアフタヌーンティーが有り､嬉しいサービスでした。

ウブドシティーまでのシャトルが１日に数本有るのですが､もう少し増やして頂けるといいなぁ？と思います。(タクシーは呼んで頂けます)

まとめ:ウブドシティーから少し離れているので少し不便感はありますが､その分絶景を見る事が出来ます。足りない部分も有りますがリーズナブルだし差し引きしても､また宿泊すると思います。

text: Wir waren vor ca. 2 Wochen in diesem Hotel weil das Hotel welches wir ursprünglich gebucht hatten, einen Rohrschaden hatte und uns umbuchen musste. Die Angestellten sind sehr freundlich und die Zimmer tip top. Das Frühstück aber ist absolut unzureichend, bei uns gab es 3 Sorten Cornflakes, Toast, ein paar Früchte und eine Auswahl an Salaten. Möchte man Fleisch oder Eier haben muss man dies Bestellen was uns nicht so gut gefiel. Wir schätzen ein reichhaltiges Buffet am Morgen. text: Жили в отеле неделю! Так как на Бали в марте не сезон, народу в отеле было мало! Большой бассейн (под инфинити), красивый вид в далеке, но сразу за отелем есть рисовые поля, которые были пустые (просто лужа грязи). Персонал очень отзывчивый, делали все, что в их силах, но немного ленивый! Номер просторный, с балконом. Пару раз были проблемы с горячей водой. Очень много муравьев и ящериц на территории. Про еду: есть два ресторана - местная и европейская кухня! Местный нам не очень понравился, цены не дешёвые! А европейский по вечерам всегда закрывали, хотя должны работать до 21:00.  Так же есть спа, но мы не ходили! В целом, все было хорошо
title: Хороший отель

owner_response.text:
Привет Вика,

Спасибо за ваш отзыв о нашей гостинице. Прежде всего, простите нас за любые недостатки нашего сервиса, из-за которых вам стало не по себе.

Согласно вашему отзыву о рисовых полях, которые были пусты (просто лужа грязи), наш фермер, владеющий рисовым падиком, собирает его около 1-2 месяцев назад. Это требует времени, чтобы пересадить, и позвольте рис, растущему естественно красивым способом. Нам очень жаль, что вам не понравилось мнение, когда вы остались с нами.

О ваших комментариях наших сотрудников, которые кажутся немного ленивыми, мы абсолютно разделяем мнение нашей команды о нашем улучшении. Этот шаг будет связан с большим объемом муравьев, горячей водой и ресторанным обслуживанием.

Другая вещь ваша информация о ящерицах на нашей территории, это могло случиться, потому что наш отель расположен рядом с рисовым риса с естественной атмосферой.

Последнее, мы хотели бы еще раз поблагодарить вас за то, что мы рассмотрели наш отель для вашего пребывания и дали нам некоторую обратную связь для лучшего обслуживания и гостеприимства.

Желаем вам хорошего дня и надеемся увидеть вас снова!

Много благословений,
Maey for Royal Casa Ganesha
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik
